controller

Interface IDialogController

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DialogController

    public interface IDialogController
    Author:
    Giacomo Scaparrotti This is the controller of ITableDialog. Its purpose is adding, removing and resetting orders, updating the dialog and printing the bill. Moreover, it dispatches the IMenu, whose use is necessary in the Dialog class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void commandAdd(int tableNumber, IDish item, int amount) 
      void commandOrdersViewUpdate(int tableNumber) 
      void commandPrint(int tableNumber, javax.swing.JTable c, java.lang.String up, java.lang.String down) 
      void commandRemove(int tableNumber, IDish item, int amount) 
      void commandReset(int tableNumber) 
      void commandUpdateProcessedOrders(int tableNumber, IDish item) 
      IDish[] getMenu() 
      void setView(ITableDialog td) 
      void updateReferences()
      This method is to be called every time you load a IRestaurant object from a file, e.g. using IMainController.commandLoad().

    • Method Detail

      • setView

        void setView(ITableDialog td)
        Parameters:
        td - The ITableDialog instance used in the application This method determines the TableDialog which is affected by this controller. This TableDialog will show the orders and the bill. Other TableDialogs may call this class' methods, but the behavior may be undefined, which is to say that only one Dialog may be updated.

      • updateReferences

        void updateReferences()
        This method is to be called every time you load a IRestaurant object from a file, e.g. using IMainController.commandLoad(). Since the loading will change the references in the MainController class, you have to update the references to those object contained in this very class' instance. This method may not be useful if the architecture of the program is very different from the current one.

      • getMenu

        IDish[] getMenu()
        Returns:
        An array containing all the IDish on the menu This method provides an easy way to get all the dishes on the menu.

      • commandOrdersViewUpdate

        void commandOrdersViewUpdate(int tableNumber)
        Parameters:
        tableNumber - the number of the table you want to update the view Update the graphical representation of all this table's orders on the previously set ITableDialog. If a TableDialog is not present, the behaviour is undetermined (e.g. an exception may be thrown).

      • commandAdd

        void commandAdd(int tableNumber,
                IDish item,
                int amount)
        Parameters:
        tableNumber - the number of the table
        item - a IDish object containing the dish to be added
        amount - the amount of dishes to add. Adds the specified dish to the orders of the selected table, in the specified amount.

      • commandRemove

        void commandRemove(int tableNumber,
                   IDish item,
                   int amount)
        Parameters:
        tableNumber - the number of the table
        item - a IDish object containing the dish to be removed
        amount - the amount of dishes to remove. Removes the specified dish to the orders of the selected table, in the specified amount.

      • commandUpdateProcessedOrders

        void commandUpdateProcessedOrders(int tableNumber,
                                  IDish item)
        Parameters:
        tableNumber - the number of the table
        item - a IDish object containing the dish to be removed Update the number of the processed orders relative to the selected table and dish. This is useful if you want to distinguish between processed and unprocessed orders.

      • commandPrint

        void commandPrint(int tableNumber,
                  javax.swing.JTable c,
                  java.lang.String up,
                  java.lang.String down)
        Parameters:
        tableNumber - the number of the table
        c - A JTable containing the orders to print
        up - a String which will be printed at the top of the document
        down - up a String which will be printed at the bottom of the document This method helps you printing the bill of the selected table. It relays on the presence of a JTable containing all the orders, so it may not be useful if the implementation of TableDialog does not involve a JTable. You can also specify two string, which will be printed at the top and at the bottom of the page. For example, you can use them to print the number of the table or the name of the restaurant.

      • commandReset

        void commandReset(int tableNumber)
        Parameters:
        tableNumber - This method erases all the orders of the selected table.
